tajweed_content_desc: The science of tajweed is the knowledge used to understand the rules and methods of reciting (pronouncing) the letters of the Qur'an correctly and beautifully. Its purpose is to preserve the recitation of the Qur'an from errors and changes, as well as to safeguard the mouth from reading mistakes. Studying the science of tajweed is a communal obligation (Fardlu Kifayah), while reciting the Qur'an correctly according to the rules of tajweed is an individual obligation (Fardlu 'Ain).
examples: Examples:

tajweed_laws.name: Idzhar
tajweed_laws.summary: Idzhar/Idzhar Halqy tajweed law happens when a noon sakinah or tanween meets the letters of idzhar (ا ع غ ح خ ها), it is pronounced clearly and distinctly.
tajweed_laws.detail: The letters of idzhar are pronounced clearly because their point of articulation is the mouth and they are in the throat.
examples: مِنْ آَلِ فِرْعَوْنَ Noon sakinah meets أ
فَكُلُوا مِنْهَا حَيْثُ Noon sakinah meets هـ
بِغَافِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ Noon sakinah meets ع
مِنْ غَفُورٍ رَحِيم Noon sakinah meets غ
أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌ Tanween meets ح
كُونُوا قِرَدَةً خَاسِئِينَ Tanween meets خ

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Bighunnah
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Bighunnah tajweed law happens when a noon sakinah or tanween meets the letters of idgham bighunnah (ي ن م و), it is pronounced with a nasal sound.
tajweed_laws.detail: Idgham means to merge, and bighunnah means nasal sound. So the letters of idgham bighunnah are pronounced with a nasal sound.
examples: مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَتَمَاسَّا Noon sakinah meets ي
إِلَّا سَاعَةً مِنْ نَهَارٍ Noon sakinah meets ن
وَأَنْفِقُوا مِنْ مَا رَزَقْنَاكُمْ Noon sakinah meets م
مِنْ دُونِهِ مِنْ وَالٍ Noon sakinah meets و
بِبُهْتَانٍ يَفْتَرِينَهُ Tanween meets ي
حِطَّةٌ نَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ Tanween meets ن
رَقَبَةٍ مِنْ قَبْلِ Tanween meets م
مِنْ خَيْلٍ وَلَا رِكَابٍ Tanween meets و

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Bilaghunnah
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Bilaghunnah tajweed law happens when a noon sakinah or tanween meets the letters of idgham bilaghunnah (ل ر), it is pronounced by merging without nasal sound.
tajweed_laws.detail: Idgham means to merge, and bilaghunnah means without nasal sound. So the letters of idgham bilaghunnah are pronounced by merging without a nasal sound.
examples: فَضْلًا مِنْ رَبِّكَ Noon sakinah meets ر
قَالَ لَمْ أَكُنْ لِأَسْجُدَ Noon sakinah meets ل
لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةً لِلَّذِينَ Tanween meets ل
سَيَقُولُونَ ثَلَاثَةٌ رَابِعُهُمْ Tanween meets ر

tajweed_laws.name: Iqlab
tajweed_laws.summary: Iqlab tajweed law happens when a noon sakinah or tanween meets the letter of iqlab (ب), it is pronounced by replacing it with the letter meem.
tajweed_laws.detail: Iqlab means to merge or, in simpler terms, to replace the letter with the letter meem.
examples: أَنْ تُنْبِتُوا Noon sakinah meets ب
كُلُّ حِزْبٍ بِمَا Tanween meets ب

tajweed_laws.name: Ikhfaa
tajweed_laws.summary: Ikhfaa/Ikhfaa Haqiqi tajweed law happens when a noon sakinah or tanween meets the letters of ikhfa haqiqi (ت ث ج د ذ ز س ش ص ض ط ظ ف ق ك), it is pronounced softly.
tajweed_laws.detail: Ikhfaa means to conceal or hide, while haqiqi means real or true. So the letters of ikhfa haqiqi are pronounced softly.
examples: أَنْتُمْ Noon sakinah meets ت
مَنْثُورًا Noon sakinah meets ث
فَأَنْجَيْنَاه Noon sakinah meets ج
عِنْدَهُ Noon sakinah meets د
لِيُنْذِرَكُمْ Noon sakinah meets ذ
أُنْزِلَ Noon sakinah meets ز
نَنْسَخْ Noon sakinah meets س
مَنْشُورً Noon sakinah meets ش
رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا Tanween meets ص
وَكُلًّا ضَرَبْنَا Tanween meets ض
صَعِيدًا طَيِّبًا Tanween meets ط
ظِلًّا ظَلِيلً Tanween meets ظ
سَفَرٍ فَعِدَّةٌ Tanween meets ف
عَلِيمٌ قَدِيرٌ Tanween meets ق
وَرِزْقٌ كَرِيمٌ Tanween meets ك

tajweed_laws.name: Idzhar Shafawy
tajweed_laws.summary: Idzhar Shafawy tajweed law happens when a meem sakinah meets the letters of idzhar shafawy (ا ت ث ج ح خ د ذ ر ز س ش ص ض ط ظ ع غ ف ق ك ل ن و ه ي), it must be pronounced clearly even with closed lips.
tajweed_laws.detail: The letters of idzhar shafawy are so many, except for meem and ba, because the two letters are owned by ikhfa shafawy and idgham meemi.
examples: أَأَنْذَرْتَهُمْ أَم Meem sakinah meets ا
أَنْعَمْتَ Meem sakinah meets ت
ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يُحْيِيكُمْ Meem sakinah meets ث
أَنَّ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٍ Meem sakinah meets ج
يَمْحَقُ اللَّهُ الرِّبَا Meem sakinah meets ح

tajweed_laws.name: Ikhfaa Shafawy
tajweed_laws.summary: Ikhfaa Shafawy tajweed law happens when a meem sakinah meets the letters of ikhfa shafawy (ب), it is pronounced softly by disguising the sound with a nasal tone.
tajweed_laws.detail: Although the nasal sound isn't very clear because the letters Meem Sukun and Ba have the same exit point, namely two lips. There is only one letter for Ikhfaa Shafawy. The letters are the same as iqlab, but the way to read them is not merged like iqlab.
examples: وَمَا هُمْ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ Meem sakinah meets the letter of ب
وَهُمْ بِالْآَخِرَةِ Meem sakinah meets the letter of ب
عَلَيْهِمْ بِعِلْمٍ Meem sakinah meets the letter of ب

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Meem Saakin
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Meem Saakin tajweed law happens when meem sakinah meets the letters of idgham meemi (م), it is pronounced in the same way as meem shaddah.
tajweed_laws.detail: The letter of Idgham Meem Saakin is only one. The letter is meem. So, Idgham Meem Saakin is the meeting of two meem letters. The way to pronounce it is the same as pronouncing the meem with shaddah. Because, meem shaddah is a combination of meem sakinah and meem with harakah.
examples: وَكَمْ مِنْ قَرْيَةٍ Meem sakinah meets م
كُلَّمَا أَضَاءَ لَهُمْ مَشَوْا فِيهِ Meem sakinah meets م
إِلَيْكُمْ مِنْ رَبِّكُمْ Meem sakinah meets م

tajweed_laws.name: Ghunnah
tajweed_laws.summary: Ghunnah tajweed law happens if there is a shaddah on the letter meem (مّ) and noon (ن), it is pronounced with a nasal sound and is called Ghunnah.
tajweed_laws.detail: Ghunnah means: nasaling (at the bridge of the nose). So the way to read it is by humming the letters meem and noon taysdid on the bridge of the nose for 2 - 3 harakah.
examples: امَّةٌ Meem Shaddah
النَّارِ Noon Shaddah
أمَنَّا Noon Shaddah
الْجَنَّةُ Noon Shaddah

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Mutamathelyne
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Mutamathelyne tajweed law happens when a letter meets a similar letter, with the same makhraj and characteristic, where the first letter is sukun (silent) and the second letter has a harakah.
tajweed_laws.detail:
The way to read it is by inserting the first sukun letter into the second harokah letter. And being pressured, he was detained for no more than one harokah.
The rule of Idgham Mutamathelyne has exceptions. If the letter Wawu with sukun meets the letter (و) or if the letter Ya' with sukun meets the letter (ي), then it should not be pronounced with Idgham (merging) into the second letter, but it should be read with a long pronunciation or MAD as it is supposed to be. An additional exception is that if the letter before the Wawu (و) or Ya (ي) has a fathah harakat, then Idgham can be applied (https://www.khudzilkitab.com/2019/01/idgham-mutamatsilain-lengkap.html).
examples: فَلْيَكْتُبْ بَيْنَكُمْ Ba sakinah meets ب
طَلَعَتْ تَزَاوَرُ Ta sakinah meets ت
وَقَدْ دَخَلُوا Da sakinah meets د
إِذْ ذَهَبَ Dza sakinah meets ذ
يُدْرِكُكُمْ Ka sakinah meets ك
الَمْ أَقُلْ لَكَ Lam sakinah meets ل
َأَنْتُمْ مُسْلِمُوْنَ Meem sakinah meets م
مِنْ نَفْعِهِمَا Noon sakinah meets ن

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Mutajaanisain
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Mutajaanisain tajweed law happens if there is a letter with the meaning of sukun opposite a letter with the meaning of harakah, both have the same makhroj but have different characteristics.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is by inserting or idghom the first letter in the second letter.
examples: إِذْ مَمَّتْ طَائِفَتْنِ Ta sakinah meets ط
اثْقَلَتْ دَعَوَا اللهَ Ta sakinah meets د
لَقَدْ تَابَ Da sakinah meets ت
إِذْ ظَلَمُوا Dzal sakinah meets ظ
لَئِنْ بَسَطْتَ Tho sakinah meets ت

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Mutaqaaribain
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Mutaqaaribain tajweed law happens if a letter with a sukun meets a letter with a harakah, the two letters are close to each other, makhroj and its properties.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is by inserting or adding the first letter to the second letter.
examples: ارْ كَيْمَعَنَا Ba sakinah meets م
َذَّبَتْ ثَمُود Ta sakinah meets ث
يَلْهَثْ ذَلِكَ Tsa sakinah meets ذ
نَخْلُقُكُمْ Qaf sakinah meets ك
ُلْ رَّبِّي Lam sakinah meets رَ

tajweed_laws.name: Idzhar Qamariyah
tajweed_laws.summary: Idzhar Qamariyah tajweed law happens when a lam ta’rief meets the letters of idzhar qamariyah (ء ب ج ح خ ع غ ف ق ك م و ه ي), it must be pronounced clearly.
tajweed_laws.detail: Qamar in Arabic means moon. Meanwhile, lam ta'rief is likened to a star. This is because the stars remain visible even though they meet the moon.
examples: لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ ذَلُولً Alif lam meets ء
فَارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ Alif lam meets ب
أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ Alif lam meets ج
خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَالْحَيَاةَ Alif lam meets ح
وَهُوَ اللَّطِيفُ الْخَبِيرُ Alif lam meets خ

tajweed_laws.name: Idgham Syamsiyah
tajweed_laws.summary: Idgham Syamsiyah tajweed law happens when a lam ta’rief meets the letters of qamariyah, other than idzhar qamariyah (ت ث د ذ ر ز س ش ص ض ط ظ ل ن), it is called idgham.
tajweed_laws.detail: Syamsiyah means sun, so if Alif Lam, which is likened to a star, meets the sun, it becomes less visible. Because this is not readable, the alif lam which meets the syamsiyah letters, seems to be shaddah, or inserted into the next letter.
examples: وَأَنْزَلَ التَّوْرَاةَ Alif lam meets ت
مِنَ الثَّمَرَاتِ Alif lam meets ث
يَوْمِ الدِّينِ Alif lam meets د
وَالذَّاكِرِينَ Alif lam meets ذ
الرَّحْمَنِ Alif lam meets ر

tajweed_laws.name: Lam Tafkhim
tajweed_laws.summary: Lam Tafkhim tajweed law happens when there is the letter lam (ل) in the word Allah (اللّه) preceded by a letter with a Fatha or Damma vowel.
tajweed_laws.detail: It must be recited thickly or with Lam Tafkhim, which is done by lifting the entire tongue and pressing it against the upper palate while emphasizing the sound strongly.
examples: َلَوْ شَاءَ اللهُ Fatha meets اللهُ
هَدْنَا اللهُ Fatha meets اللهُ
مَا شَاءَ اللهُ Fatha meets اللهُ
زِينَةَ اللهِ Fatha meets اللهُ
ذَهَبَ الله Fatha meets اللهُ
شَهِدَ اللهُ Fatha meets اللهُ
رَحْمَتَ اللهِ Fatha meets اللهُ
وَاتَّقُو الله Damma meets اللهُ
رَسُولُ اللَّهِ Damma meets اللهُ
ذُكِرَ اسْمُ اللهِ Damma meets اللهُ
ذلِكُمُ اللهُ Damma meets اللهُ
انْ لَعْنَةُ اللهِ Damma meets اللهُ
رَزَقَكُمُ اللهُ Damma meets اللهُ

tajweed_laws.name: Lam Tarqiq
tajweed_laws.summary: Lam Tarqiq tajweed law happens when there is the letter lam (ل) in the word Allah (اللّه) preceded by a letter with a Kasra vowel.
tajweed_laws.detail: It must be recited thinly or with Lam Tarqiq
examples: مِنْ دُونِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
اَلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
َرْضِ اللَّهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
رَسُولِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
بِسْمِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
عِنْدِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ
وَلْيَتَّقِ الله Kasra meets اللهُ
وَجْهِ اللهِ Kasra meets اللهُ

tajweed_laws.name: Qalqalah Sughra
tajweed_laws.summary: Qalqalah Sughra tajweed law happens if there is a silent qalqalah letter (ب ج د ط ق) in the middle of a sentence, it is pronounced with a bounce. It is read as qalqalah sughra.
tajweed_laws.detail: Qalqalah sughra is read thinner, like the meaning of sughra itself which means small.
examples: ثُمَّ لِيَقْطَعْ فَلْيَنْظُرْ There is a Qaf sakinah letter in the middle of the word
ثَانِيَ عِطْفِهِ  There is a Tho sakinah letter in the middle of the word
وَقَوْمُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ There is a Ba sakinah letter in the middle of the word
فَعَلَيَّ إِجْرَامِي There is a Ja sakinah letter in the middle of the word
يَدْعُو مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ  There is a Da sakinah letter in the meiddle of the word

tajweed_laws.name: Qalqalah Kubra
tajweed_laws.summary: Qalqalah Kubra tajweed law happens if there is a silent qalqalah letter (ب ج د ط ق) at the end of a sentence, it is pronounced with a bounce. It is read as qalqalah kubro.
tajweed_laws.detail: Qalqalah kubro, how to read it, is reflected more clearly and louder, like the meaning of kubro which means big.
examples: بَيْنِ الصُّلْبِ وَالتَّرَائِبِ There is a Ba letter in the end of the sentence
وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْبُرُوجِ There is a Ja letter in the end of the sentence
وَالْيَوْمِ الْمَوْعُودِ There is a Da letter in the end of the sentence
قَائِمًا بِالْقِسْطِ There is a Tho letter in the end of the sentence
وَالسَّمَاءِ وَالطَّارِقِ There is a Qaf letter in the end of the sentence

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Tabe'ee
tajweed_laws.summary: The law of reading is called Madd Tabe'ee, that is, if the letter whose sound is extended is a letter with the harokat Damma (ُ) and after it there is the letter Wau Sukun (ﻭْ), a letter with the harokat kasroh and after that there is the letter Yaa' Sukun (ﻱْ), a letter with the harokat fathah (َ) and after that there is the letter Alif (ا)
examples: يَسْتَبْشِرُونَ Damma meets و sukun
أَنْ تَكُونَ Damma meets و sukun
وَيَقْذِفُوْنَ Damma meets و sukun
اجُورَكُمْ Damma meets و sukun
َجْرٌ عَظِيم Kasra meets ي sukun
صدِقِينَ Kasra meets ي sukun
َأَيْتَ الْمُنْفِقِين Kasra meets ي sukun
فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ Kasra meets ي sukun
جَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ Fatha meets ا
فَقَدْ فَازَ Fatha meets ا
َأَمْوَالَهُم Fatha meets ا
أَمْوَالِكُمْ Fatha meets ا
مَا بِصَاحِبِكُمْ Fatha meets ا

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Wajib Muttasil
tajweed_laws.summary: Madd Wajib Muttasil tajweed law happens if Madd Tabe'ee meets a living Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence, it is mandatory to prolong it.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it must be extended to two and a half Alif or five harokat or two and a half times the length of Madd Tabe'ee.
examples: مِنْهُ الْمَاءُ Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
صَفْرَاءُ Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
دُعَاءً Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
مَنْ يَشَاءُ Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
فَبَاءُ Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
أَحْيَاء Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
سَوَاء Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
امَنَ السُّفَهَاءُ Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
شُهَدَاءَ Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence
وَلَوْ شَاءَ Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) within a word/sentence

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Ja'eez Munfasil
tajweed_laws.summary: The recitation rule is called Madd Ja'eez Munfasil when Madd Tabe'ee (ء) is in a different word.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is better to extend it like the length of Madd Wajib Muttashil, but also may be extended like the length of Madd Tabe'ee.
examples: فِيهَا أَبَدًا Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) in different word
بِمَا أُنْزِلَ Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) in different word
وَمَا أُنْزِلَ Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) in different word
ذُرِّيَّتِنَا أُمُّةً Madd Tabe'ee meets Hamzah (ء) in different word

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Lazim Kilmi Muthaqqal
tajweed_laws.summary: Madd Laazim Kalimee Muthaqqal tajweed law happens if Madd Tabe'ee is faced with letters with shaddah within a word.
tajweed_laws.detail: The pronunciation should be prolonged first for 3 alif or 6 harakah before shaddah is added.
examples: هُمُ الضَّآلُّونَ Madd Tabe'ee meets shaddah letter within a word
وَلَا الضَّآلِّينَ Madd Tabe'ee meets shaddah letter within a word
إِلَّا الضَّآلُوْنَ Madd Tabe'ee meets shaddah letter within a word
جَاءَتِ الطَّآمَّةُ Madd Tabe'ee meets shaddah letter within a word
فِي السِّلْمِ كَآفَّةً Madd Tabe'ee meets shaddah letter within a word

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Lazim Kilmi Mukhaffaf
tajweed_laws.summary: Madd Laazim Kalimee Mukhaffaf tajweed law happens if Madd Tabe'ee meets a sukun-harokat letter not at the end of a word. (prolonged up to three alif or six harakah).
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is like Madd Laazim Muthaqqal Kilmi (extended to three alif or six harakah).
examples: آلان only in Surah Yunus

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Al-Leen
tajweed_laws.summary: Madd Al-Leen tajweed law happens if there is a Madd letter, whether it is Wau Sukun (ﻭْ) or Yaa' Sukun (ﻱْ) preceded by a fathah-harokat letter.
tajweed_laws.detail: It is pronounced softly and smoothly.
examples: بِالْغَيْبِ Fatha meets يْ
عَلَيْهِ Fatha meets يْ
عَلَيْكُمْ Fatha meets يْ
إِلَيْكَ Fatha meets يْ
يَدَيْهَا Fatha meets يْ
فَتَمَنَّوُ الْمَوْتَ Fatha meets وْ
فَوْقَكُمْ Fatha meets وْ
يَوْمَ Fatha meets وْ
قَوْمًا Fatha meets وْ

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Aridh Lissukun
tajweed_laws.summary: Madd Aridh Lissukun tajweed law happens if there is Madd Tabe'ee or Madd Al-Leen followed by a waqf (stopping place).
tajweed_laws.detail:
There are 3 ways to read it:
a. What is more important is that it is read long, the same as Madd Wajib Mutashil (three alif or six harakah).
b. The middle (medium) one can only be read as two Alif or four harokats (twice Madd Tabe'ee).
c. The sortest one may be only read as Madd Tabe'ee (two harakah).
examples: ِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ . Madd Tabe'ee in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
شَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ . Madd Tabe'ee in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
ِهِمُ الْأَسْبَابُ . Madd Tabe'ee in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
مِنَ النَّارِ . Madd Tabe'ee in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
شَدِيدُ الْعَذَابِ . Madd Tabe'ee in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُحْسِنِينَ . Madd Tabe'ee in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ . Madd Tabe'ee in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs
شَاكِرٌ عَلِيمٌ . Madd Tabe'ee in the end of a sentence/meet waqfs

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Shilah Qashirah
tajweed_laws.summary: Madd Shilah Qashirah tajweed law happens if the letter Haa Dlomir/third person pronoun (noun) comes (ه) after a vowel-harokat letter and is not connected to a sukun or shaddah letter or the letter alif.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is extended to one Alif or two harokat or like the length of Madd Tabe'ee.
examples: بِهِ عِنْدَ prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee
وَرَسُولِهِ كُنتُمْ prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee
بِيَدِهِ عُقْدَةُ prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee
ايْتِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee
جُنُودِهِ قَالُو prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee
لَهُ مُلْكُ prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee
أَجْرُهُ عِنْدَ prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee
وَعَدَّدَهُ يَحْسِبُ prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee
وَرَحْمَتُهُ لَكُنْتُمْ prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee
ِنَّهُ هُوَ  prolong (ه) like Madd Tabe'ee

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Shilah Thawilah
tajweed_laws.summary: Madd Shilah Thawilah tajweed law happens if Madd Shilah Qashirah meets Hamzah (ء) preceded by a vowel-harokat letter.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is like reading Madd Ja'eez Munfasil, meaning it can be extended to two and a half Alif or one Alif like Madd Tabe'ee.
examples: أَمْرُةَٓ إِذَا prolong (ه) like Madd Ja'eez Munfasil
مِنْ دُونِهِٓ الهَةً prolong (ه) like Madd Ja'eez Munfasil
عَلَى مَوْتِهِٓ إِلَّا prolong (ه) like Madd Ja'eez Munfasil
وَرَسُولُهُٓ إِلَّا prolong (ه) like Madd Ja'eez Munfasil
وَأَزْوَاجُهُٓ أُمَّهْتُهُمْ prolong (ه) like Madd Ja'eez Munfasil
عِنْدَهُٓ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ prolong (ه) like Madd Ja'eez Munfasil
أَنَّ مَالَهُٓ أَخْلَدَهُ prolong (ه) like Madd Ja'eez Munfasil
مِنْدُوْنِهِٓ إِلها prolong (ه) like Madd  Ja'eez Munfasil
ربهِٓ أَحَدًا prolong (ه) like Madd Ja'eez Munfasil
عِلْمِهِٓ إِلَّا prolong (ه) like Madd Ja'eez Munfasil

tajweed_laws.name: Madd 'Ewadh
tajweed_laws.summary: Madd 'Ewadh tajweed law happens if there is fathatain vowels (ً) falling on waqf (pause), at the end of a sentence (except for ta' marbuthoh), or mentioned as a replacement for tanween so that it is no longer pronounced.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is extended one Alif like Madd Tabe'ee.
examples: .عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا prolong (مً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا prolong (مً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.هَجْرًا جَمِيلاً prolong (لاً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.كَانَ مِيْقَاتًا prolong (تً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.شَيْءٍ عَدَدًا prolong (دً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.مَسْرُورًا prolong (رً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.سَبْعًا شِدَادًا prolong (دً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.نَهَا تَفْجِيرًا prolong (رً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.سَمِيعًا بَصِيرًا prolong (رً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا prolong (دً) like Madd Tabe'ee
.ذلِكَ سَبِيلاً prolong (لاً) like Madd Tabe'ee

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Al-Badal
tajweed_laws.summary: Madd Al-Badal tajweed law happens if Hamzah (ء) meets Madd from a sukun-hamzah, and this hamzah is changed and replaced with Alif (ا), Wau (ﻭ).
tajweed_laws.detail: It is pronounced by prolonging it for one alif or two harakah, like Madd Tabe'ee.
examples: أُوتُوا prolong (أ) like Madd Tabe'ee
إِيْتُونِي prolong (أ) like Madd Tabe'ee
أَدَمُ prolong (أ) like Madd Tabe'ee
إِيْمَانُ prolong (أ) like Madd Tabe'ee
أَتُوا prolong (أ) like Madd Tabe'ee

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Lazim Harfi Mukhaffaf
tajweed_laws.summary: The law of recitation called Madd Laazim Harfi Mukhaffaf is when there is the beginning of a verse in the Quran that contains one or more of the letters: Haa' (ﺡ), Yaa' (ﻱ), Tho' (ط), Ha' (ه), Ro' (ر).
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to read it is extended one Alif like Madd Tabe'ee.
examples: حٰمٓ read HAAMIIM
يٰسٓ read YAASIIN
طٰهٰ read THOOHAA
طٰسٓ read THOOSIIN

tajweed_laws.name: Mad Lazim Harfi Muthaqqal
tajweed_laws.summary: The law of recitation called Madd Laazim Harfi Muthaqqal is when there is the beginning of a verse in the Quran that contains one or more of the letters: Noon' (ن), Qof' (ﻕ), Shod' (ص), Ain' (ع), Sin (س), Lam (ل), Kaf (ك), and Meem (م).
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to recite it must be prolonged, namely with three Alifs or six vowel counts.
examples: الٓمٓ read ALIFLAAAAAAMIIIIIIMM
الٓمٓصٓ read ALIFLAAAAAAMMIIIIIIMSHOOOOOOD
طٰسٓمٓ read THOOSIIIIIIMMIIIIIIM
الٓمٓرٰ read ALIFLAAAAAAMMIIIIIIMROO

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Laazim Musyabba'
tajweed_laws.summary: The law of recitation called Madd Laazim Musyabaa' is similar to Madd Laazim Harfi Muthaqqal, after the prolongation there is a silent letter which is not assimilated or doubled.
tajweed_laws.detail: The way to recite it must be prolonged like Madd Laazim Harfi Muthaqqal, which is with three Alifs.
examples: صٓ‌ read SHOOOOOOD
قٓ read QOOOOOOF

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Tamkeen
tajweed_laws.summary: The recitation rule called Madd Tamkeen occurs when there is a Yaa' Sukun (ﻱْ) preceded by a Yaa' with shaddah and a Kasra vowel (ﻱِ).
tajweed_laws.detail: The reading is established with shaddah and its natural Madd is extended to the length of two vowels or one alif.
examples: وَإِذَا حُيِّيْتُمْ Yaa' shaddah meets (يْ)
وَخَاتَمَ النَّبِيِّينَ Yaa' shaddah meets (يْ)
رَبَّانِيِّينَ Yaa' shaddah meets (يْ)
في الْأُمِّيِّينَ Yaa' shaddah meets (يْ)

tajweed_laws.name: Madd Farq'ee
tajweed_laws.summary: The reading rule called Madd Farq'ee is a Madd that in the Quran only occurs in four places.
tajweed_laws.detail: The reading must be elongated to distinguish between a question or not, so the elongation makes it clear that the sentence is in the form of a question.
examples: الأُنْثَيَيْنِ الذَّكَرَيْنِ حَرَّمَ أَما on Surah Al-An'am
قُلْ اللَّهُ أَذِنَ لَكُمْ on Surah Yunus
اللَّهُ خَيْرٌ أَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ on Surah An-Naml

tajweed_laws.name: Waqf Mamnu'
tajweed_laws.summary: Prohibition of stopping, except if there is a sign below it indicating the beginning of a verse that allows an absolute stop and except at the end of the verse.

tajweed_laws.name: Wasl Awla
tajweed_laws.summary: Continuing is preferable but stopping is allowed.

tajweed_laws.name: Waqf Ja'iz
tajweed_laws.summary: Stopping or continuing is permissible.

tajweed_laws.name: Waqf Awla
tajweed_laws.summary: Stopping is preferable but continuing is allowed.

tajweed_laws.name: Ta'anuq Al-Waqf
tajweed_laws.summary: It is permissible to stop at any word that has that sign.

tajweed_laws.name: Saktah
tajweed_laws.summary: A sign to pause briefly without exhaling (holding the breath).

tajweed_laws.name: Waqf Lazim
tajweed_laws.summary: Must stop. Continuing is prohibited.

tajweed_laws.name: Ruku'
tajweed_laws.summary: A sign indicating the limit for daily recitation and the end of a verse (a marker for those who wish to memorize the Qur'an within two years).
